Package no.ntnu.idatt1002.app.gui

Class EditProjectController

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idatt1002.app.gui.EditProjectController
public class EditProjectController extends Object
FXML Controller class for the EditProject.fxml file. Takes an existing project and allows the user to edit the project information, accounting and budgeting.

    Method

    void
    addExpenseToLocal()
    When pressing the add button, the addExpenseToLocal method will be called and depending on whether a row is selected or not, the expense will be added or updated.

  • Constructor Details

    • EditProjectController

      public EditProjectController()

  • Method Details

    • initializeWithData

      public void initializeWithData(Project project) throws NullPointerException
      Initializes the controller class.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException

    • initializeController

      public void initializeController()
      Initializes the controller class. Also sets up the text fields and tables to display the data of the project that is being edited.

    • toggleAccounting

      public void toggleAccounting()
      Toggle to accounting view, makes the accounting button style look active. Updates the isAccounting boolean so that when a table is changed, the correct table is updated.

    • toggleBudgeting

      public void toggleBudgeting()
      Toggle to budgeting view, makes the budgeting button style look active. Updates the isAccounting boolean so that when a table is changed, the correct table is updated.

    • selectedIncome

      public void selectedIncome()
      Checks if the user has selected an income and if so, it will input the income values into the income fields. If the user has clicked an empty row or the same row twice, the income fields will be reset.

      Clicking an income row will also update the selectedTransaction variable which has the effect of updating the chosen income rather than creating a new one.

    • selectedExpense

      public void selectedExpense()
      Checks if the user has selected an expense and if so, it will input the expense values into the expense fields. If the user has clicked an empty row or the same row twice, the expense fields will be reset.

      Clicking an expense row will also update the selectedTransaction variable which has the effect of updating the chosen expense rather than creating a new one.

    • addIncomeToLocal

      public void addIncomeToLocal()
      When pressing the add button, the addIncomeToLocal method will be called and depending on whether a row is selected or not, the income will be added or updated.

    • addExpenseToLocal

      public void addExpenseToLocal()
      When pressing the add button, the addExpenseToLocal method will be called and depending on whether a row is selected or not, the expense will be added or updated.

    • removeTransaction

      public void removeTransaction(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Removes a transaction from the local overview when the delete or backspace key is pressed. Also checks if the overview is set to accounting or budgeting.

    • saveProject

      public void saveProject()
      Updates the project with the new values and saves it to the user registry. It does this by deleting the old project and adding the new one.

    • deleteProject

      public void deleteProject()
      Deletes the current project. A popup will appear prompting the user if the really want to delete the project. If no, the deletion is aborted. If yes, the project is deleted from the registry and the user is returned to the all projects page.
